SimpleGUIComponent Class Reference

This class is a simple GUI component that by default displays a textured rectangle. More...

#include <simple_gui_component.hpp>

Detailed Description

This class is a simple GUI component that by default displays a textured rectangle.

The other GUI components are derived from this class.

Member Typedef Documentation

void SimpleGUIComponent::addAsSortedDrawItem ( const Matrix &  worldTransform  )  [virtual]

This method is called when this component is part of a gui tree existing under a GUIAttachment object, and therefore drawn in the world instead of overlaid on the screen like your usual GUI.

void SimpleGUIComponent::anchorOffset ( float  w,
float  h,
float &  xOffset,
float &  yOffset 
) const [protected]

This method finds the anchor offset this component, based on the supplied width of this component and the width of the relative parent.

All dimensions must be in clip space.

void SimpleGUIComponent::calcDrawOrder (  ) 

This method calculates the draw order of the component and its children recursively.

uint32 SimpleGUIComponent::calcDrawOrderRecursively ( uint32  drawOrder,
uint32  nextDrawOrder 
) [virtual]

This method calculates the draw order of the component and its children recursively.

Parameters:
drawOrder the drawOrder of this component
nextDrawOrder the drawOrder of the next component after this or 0 if we aren't limited.
Returns:
next drawOrder available after this component, or 0 if we ran out of drawOrders (ie hit nextDrawOrder)

void SimpleGUIComponent::clipBounds ( Vector2 &  topLeft,
Vector2 &  topRight,
Vector2 &  botLeft,
Vector2 &  botRight,
float *  out_relativeParentWidth = NULL,
float *  out_relativeParentHeight = NULL 
) const [virtual]

This method returns the bounds of the component, in clip coordinates, adjusted by the anchor points.

It does not apply the run time transform to the bounds, so you can treat this method as returning local space bounds.

Gets the draw order.

This should be called from this class and SimpleGUI only. Used for handling mouse events.

Returns:
draw order of the component according to the last draw.

This should be called from this class and SimpleGUI only. Used for handling mouse events.

Parameters:
order Value incremented each time a component is rendered.

bool SimpleGUIComponent::handleAxisEvent ( const AxisEvent &  event  )  [virtual]

This method handles mouse events for the gui system.

Axis events are passed on to the whatever component(s) has(have) the focus.

Parameters:
event The mouse event to handle.
Returns:
True if the mouse event was handled.

bool SimpleGUIComponent::handleKeyEvent ( const KeyEvent &  event  )  [virtual]

This method handles key events for the gui system.

Key events are passed on to the current component(s) that has(have) the focus, if any.

Parameters:
event The key event to handle.
Returns:
True if the key event was handled.

bool SimpleGUIComponent::handleMouseEvent ( const MouseEvent &  event  )  [virtual]

This method handles mouse events for the gui system.

Mouse events are passed on to the whatever component is at the mouse location.

event The mouse event to handle.
Returns:
True if the mouse event was handled.

bool SimpleGUIComponent::handlesInput (  )  const [protected]

This method returns whether this component is able to handle input events (i.e.

if it or any of its parents are invisible then it will not handle input events).

Returns:
True if this component is currently able to handle input events.

bool SimpleGUIComponent::hasChild ( const SimpleGUIComponent *  child,
bool  deepSearch 
) const

This method finds out if a component is in the children hierarchy.

Parameters:
child component to search for in the hierarchy
deepSearch if true it will search the full hierarchy, otherwise just the direct children.
Returns:
true if "child" is in the hierarchy, false otherwise.

SimpleGUIComponent::eSizeMode SimpleGUIComponent::heightMode (  )  const

bool SimpleGUIComponent::hitTest ( const Vector2 &  testPos  )  const

This method checks if the given position is over the component.

Because the test takes the component runTimeTransform to compute the projected screen coordinates of the component, it works even if the component is in 3D space (attached to a model via PyGUIAttachment).

Parameters:
testPos the position to test
Returns:
True if the position is over the component. False otherwise.
